description: From French persiflage, from persifler (“to quiz, tease, mock”), from per- + siffler (“to whistle”), from Latin sībilō (“whistle”).

examples: After the third strike he returned to the bench to face the inevitable persiflage from his teammates.

entries.meaning: Frivolous, lighthearted discussion of a topic.
examples: Polite dinner calls for persiflage rather than in-depth possibly offensive discussion.
